abstract.para: In this chapter we will learn how to use web service URLs to navigate the DataCleaner repository. The repository is available at the root level of the DataCleaner monitoring web application. Access is of course restricted to the tenant's home folder. Therefore, all these web services are located with URLs starting with the form:
Where 'DC' is the tenant identifier and 'DataCleaner-monitor' is the web application archive name.

section.title: Modifying result metadata
section.para: In some cases you can end up having results in the DataCleaner monitor repository which are not correctly configured. Specifically we sometimes see these situations:

listitem.para: The registered date of the result might not be correct, if the result was created at a later time than the data it represents.
The name of the associated job is wrong, if the result was uploaded from the desktop application but with a reference to a client-side job.

section.para: To fix this situation, there is a result modification web service available. The service requires the ADMIN security role.
